details: The "Homes for Intellectually Impaired Persons" is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. In this scheme, Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection are admitted into shelter homes through the Child Welfare Committees.
objective: To admit Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection into shelter homes
benefits: Free facilities of food, shelter, and care & protection are provided in these homes

criteria: The applicant should be an orphan
The applicant should be a Mentally Deficient Child (MDC)
The percentage of disability of the applicant should be 40% and above
The Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra is a mandatory document
eligibility.target_beneficiaries: Mentally Deficient Children who are in need of care and protection

steps: The applicant needs to visit the District Social Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the application form
The application form needs to be filled and submitted to the concerned authority

documents_required: Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra
compensation_for_delay: No compensation for delay in the disbursal of the scheme benefits
